content:
I do not have access to current events or recent changes. however, thailand has implemented several initiatives to promote sustainable fisheries such as:

1. catch documentation - thailand implemented a catch documentation system to monitor the movement of all fish and fishery products within its borders. this helps to prevent illegal, unreported or unregulated fishing.

2. fishing vessel registration - thailand requires all fishing vessels operating within its waters to be registered and obtain a fishing license.

3. national plan of action on iuu fishing - thailand launched a national plan of action on illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, which outlines a comprehensive strategy to combat iuu fishing and enhance sustainable fisheries management.

4. marine protected areas - thailand has designated several marine protected areas to conserve important fish habitats and biodiversity.

5. sustainable shrimp farming - thailand is a major producer of farmed shrimp, and has implemented sustainable shrimp farming practices to reduce negative impacts on the environment and ensure the long-term viability of the industry.

6. traceability systems - thailand has implemented traceability systems to allow consumers to track the origin and journey of seafood products from the fishing vessel to the market. this helps to improve transparency and prevent iuu fishing.
